sub judice.translation[0].definitions[0]: a legal case being considered sub judice is now being dealt with by a court, and therefore is not allowed to be publicly discussed, for example in a newspaper
sub judice.translation[1].definitions[0]: if a legal case is sub judice, it is now being dealt with by a court, and therefore people are not allowed to discuss it publicly, for example in newspapers
The newspaper claimed it did not know the material was sub judice.
